DataElement.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Thyroid Gland Disorder Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the name of the thyroid gland disorder, found in the record of a patient's medical background.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Thyroid Gland
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced._A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg (JP) 12/2010.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inflammatory disorder that affects the thyroid gland.  It is characterized by the infiltration of the thyroid parenchyma by lymphocytes.  It includes Hashimoto thyroiditis and subacute lymphocytic thyroiditis.

Concepts.definition: An inflammatory disorder that affects the thyroid gland.  It is characterized by the infiltration of the thyroid parenchyma by lymphocytes.  It includes Hashimoto thyroiditis and subacute lymphocytic thyroiditis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic architectural pattern characterized by the presence of proliferating non-neoplastic or neoplastic cells forming single or multiple nodules within a lesion.: An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic architectural pattern characterized by the presence of proliferating non-neoplastic or neoplastic cells forming single or multiple nodules within a lesion.
An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Thyroid Gland Disease or Disorder Name
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
